column1: I have here in a test tube some water in which a small piece of meat was placed a few days ago. The test tube has been in rather a warm room
column2: and the meat has begun to decompose. What has here taken place is the first step in this inquiry. This has been the question at which scientific men have been working
column3: and from the study of which has come a valuable addition to surgical knowledge associated with the name of Professor Lister
column4: and known as antiseptic. What happens to this meat
column5: and what is going on in the water which surrounds it? How long will it be before all the smell of putrefaction has gone and the water is clear again? For it does in time become clear
column6: and instead of the meat we find a fine powdery substance at the bottom of the test tube. It may take weeks before this process is completed
column7: depending on the rate at which it goes on.
